poem:
### Winter Cuts

In the morning chill,  
pensioners count the coins of warmth,  
fingers tracing lines on frozen glass.  
Richard turns steam into words,  
says, "NHS," and feels the embers stir.  
In this frostbitten landscape, political visions  
are shaped by whose breath fogs the air,  
and whose hearth glows golden in the dusk.
